extension.category: Check that the diagram represents a semantically correct OS configuration

constraints.constraint: self.Modules.ISRs->select(type = TypeType::controlled)->size() > 0 This audit rule will check that all at least one controlled ISR is defined At least one controlled ISR must be defined
self.CooperativeTasks->size() >= 2 This audit rule will check that cooperative task groups contain 2 or more tasks Cooperative task groups should contain 2 or more tasks
Task.allInstances()->select(t | t.priority = self.priority)->size() = 1 This audit rule will check that tasks do not have the same priority Tasks must have unique priorities

if self.type = TypeType::controlled then ISR.allInstances()->select(t | t.IPL = self.IPL and t.type = TypeType::controlled)->size() = 1 else true endif
This audit rule will check that controlled ISRs do not have the same priority Controlled ISRs must have unique priorities

InterruptSource.allInstances()->select(is | is.source = self.source)->size() = 1 This audit rule will check that only one instance of an interrupt source is defined There can only be one instance of each interrupt source

self.source = VectorType::SystemController or self.source = VectorType::BBC or self.source = VectorType::AES or self.source = VectorType::PHY or self.source = VectorType::UART0 or self.source = VectorType::UART1 or self.source = VectorType::Timer0 or self.source = VectorType::Timer1 or self.source = VectorType::Timer2 or self.source = VectorType::SerialInterface or self.source = VectorType::SPI or self.source = VectorType::IntelligentPeripheral or self.source = VectorType::AnaloguePeripheral or self.source = VectorType::TickTimer or self.source = VectorType::SampleFIFO or self.source = VectorType::DigitalAudioIF or self.source = VectorType::BusError or self.source = VectorType::TickTimerException or self.source = VectorType::Alignment or self.source = VectorType::IllegalInstruction or self.source = VectorType::SystemCall or self.source = VectorType::Trap or self.source = VectorType::UnimplementedModule
This audit rule will check that the interrupt source is valid for a particular target The interrupt source is not available for the OS target

if self.source = VectorType::SystemController or self.source = VectorType::BBC or self.source = VectorType::AES or self.source = VectorType::PHY or self.source = VectorType::UART0 or self.source = VectorType::UART1 or self.source = VectorType::Timer0 or self.source = VectorType::Timer1 or self.source = VectorType::Timer2 or self.source = VectorType::SerialInterface or self.source = VectorType::SPI or self.source = VectorType::IntelligentPeripheral or self.source = VectorType::AnaloguePeripheral or self.source = VectorType::TickTimer or self.source = VectorType::SampleFIFO or self.source = VectorType::DigitalAudioIF then self.SourceISR->exists(s | s.IPL <= 15) else true endif
This audit rule will check that PIC interrupt sources only stimulate an uncontrolled interrupt with IPL <=15 The interrupt source must only stimulate an uncontrolled interrupt with IPL less than or equal to 15

if self.type = TypeType::controlled then self.IPL <= 15 else true endif
This audit rule will check that controlled ISRs have an IPL <=15 Controlled ISRs must have an IPL less than or equal to 15

let MaxContIPL : Integer = ISR.allInstances()->select(i | i.type = TypeType::controlled)->sortedBy(i | i.IPL)->last().IPL in if self.type = TypeType::uncontrolled then self.IPL >= MaxContIPL and self.IPL <= 16 else true endif
This audit rule will check that uncontrolled ISRs have an IPL between the highest controlled IPL and 16 Controlled ISRs must have an IPL higher than or equal to the highest controlled ISR and less than or equal to 16
Task.allInstances()->size() <= 32 This audit rule will check that there are no more than 32 tasks defined There are more tasks defined than the maximum number allowed of 32.
Task.allInstances()->size() > 0 This audit rule will check that at least one task is defined At least one task must be defined.
self.verifyName() This audit rule will check that names are wellformed Names must be valid C identifiers.
